**Accurate significant figures**
To how many significant figures is a number \\\(x\\\) correct compared to a reference number \\\(x_0\\\)? This question is important, if loss of precision in floating point operations is to be quantified.
The precise definition of accurate significant figures may vary, here we present the rules used in the exercises
- If one or both numbers are zero, then the number of accurate significant figures is zero. - If the leftmost significant figures are at different decimal positions (just as in 7 and 10 or in 0.06 and 0.1) then the number of accurate s.f. is also zero) - Otherwise the number of accurate significant figures is the number of coinciding figures if \\\(x_0\\\) is rounded to that number of significant digits.
{@T@}
